Posted By: golia (7/30/2010 8:36:46 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The "+7/+7" is like [Righteousness](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Righteousness).
  
   
He's not that bad. For just one white mana he gains protection from the color of your choice. That's like unblockability, indestructible, and shroud all at once.
  
   
Once he gets the bonus, there are ways to take advantage of it, such as [Soul's Grace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul's Grace).
posts.html:

Posted By: Arachibutyrophobia (7/4/2009 1:41:38 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ Wolfbear2, I was able to stop a Godsire after a Titanic Ultimatum with Jareth, and only Jareth; the attacking player might have gained a lot of life, but the fact that I didn't even need to bother with protection to stop something like that is nothing short of breathtaking. Sure, he might not be a *threat*, persay(and with the ability to go protection-unblockable, I'm not sure I can agree there anyway), he's a testament to white's ability to stop threats; it's pure defensive, something most people fail to see the value in anymore.  
  
My favorite combo ever; Raksha Golden Cub with Lightning Greaves, and Jareth with Loxodon Warhammer. 9/9 double-strike life-link, protection from anything, and it becomes a 16/16 when blocking.
posts.html:
@ Wolfbear2, I was able to stop a Godsire after a Titanic Ultimatum with Jareth, and only Jareth; the attacking player might have gained a lot of life, but the fact that I didn't even need to bother with protection to stop something like that is nothing short of breathtaking. Sure, he might not be a threat, persay(and with the ability to go protection-unblockable, I'm not sure I can agree there anyway), he's a testament to white's ability to stop threats; it's pure defensive, something most people fail to see the value in anymore.

My favorite combo ever; Raksha Golden Cub with Lightning Greaves, and Jareth with Loxodon Warhammer. 9/9 double-strike life-link, protection from anything, and it becomes a 16/16 when blocking.

posts.post_content:
For those who don't know, this is one of the five legendary pit fighters from Onslaught. They all cost six mana total, three colorless and 3 of one color. They are:  
[Jareth, Leonine Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jareth, Leonine Titan), [Arcanis the Omnipotent](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arcanis the Omnipotent), [Visara the Dreadful](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Visara the Dreadful), [Rorix Bladewing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rorix Bladewing), and [Silvos, Rogue Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Silvos, Rogue Elemental)
posts.html:
For those who don't know, this is one of the five legendary pit fighters from Onslaught. They all cost six mana total, three colorless and 3 of one color. They are:
Jareth, Leonine Titan, Arcanis the Omnipotent, Visara the Dreadful, Rorix Bladewing, and Silvos, Rogue Elemental
